title: Available API endpoints
description: VersionEye is a cross-platform search engine for free/libre/open source software libraries.

actions.title: getFacebookPing
actions.description: ping pong

actions.title: postFacebookPing
actions.description: ping pong

actions.title: getGithub
actions.description:
This endpoint shows all imported repositories from your Github account.

This enpoint expects that you have a GitHub account connected and the token
is still valid. If that is not the case please visit **https://www.versioneye.com/settings/connect**.
to update your GitHub credentials.

If it shows no or old data, then you can use the `github/sync` endpoint
to update your account with the current meta data from GitHub.

actions.title: postGithubHookProjectId
actions.description: This endpoint is registered as service hook on GitHub. It triggers a project re-parse on each git push.

actions.title: getGithubSync
actions.description:
Reimports ALL GitHub Repositories. This Endpoint fetches meta information to all
repositories in your GitHub account. Meta information such as repo name, branches and
supported project files.

This endpoint works asynchronously and returns a status code. The status code is either
**running** or **done**.

actions.title: deleteGithubRepoKey
actions.description:
This Endpoint deletes a project on VersionEye!

Due the limits of our current API framework, the repo key has to be
encoded as url-safe string. That means all '/' has to be replaced with
colons ':' and '.' has to be replaced with '~'.

For example,  repository with fullname `versioneye/veye` has to transformed
to `versioneye:veye`.

actions.title: getGithubRepoKey
actions.description:
This Endpoint returns detailed information about a GitHub repository.

Due the limits of our current API framework, the repo key has to be
encoded as url-safe string. That means all '/' has to be replaced with
colons ':' and '.' has to be replaced with '~'.

For example,  repository with fullname `versioneye/veye` has to transformed
to `versioneye:veye`.

repo_key.description: encoded repo name with optional branch info.

actions.title: postGithubRepoKey
actions.description:
Use this Endpoint to import a project file from GitHub. This will create a new project on VersionEye.

Due the limits of our current API framework, the repo key has to be
encoded as url-safe string. That means all '/' has to be replaced with
colons ':' and '.' has to be replaced with '~'.

For example,  repository with fullname `versioneye/veye` has to transformed
to `versioneye:veye`.

actions.title: getMe
actions.description: On Swagger, you can create session by adding additional parameter :api_key.

actions.title: getMeComments
actions.description: shows comments of authorized user

actions.title: getMeFavorites
actions.description: shows the packages you are following

actions.title: getMeNotifications
actions.description:
This Endpoint returns the 30 latest notifications.

If there are new versions out there for software packages you follow directly on VersionEye, then
each new version is a new **notification** for your account.

actions.title: getOrganisations
actions.description: This endpoint requires the API key from a user. The result is a set of organisations and their API keys.

actions.title: getOrganisationsOrgaNameInventory
actions.description: Find a detailed description here: https://github.com/versioneye/versioneye-api/blob/master/docs/api/v2/organisation.md

post_filter.description: Post processing filter. Possible values are 'ALL', 'duplicates_only', 'show_duplicates'

actions.title: getOrganisationsOrgaNameProjects
actions.description: Returns the list of projects

actions.title: getOrganisationsOrgaNameTeams
actions.description: Returns the list of teams

actions.title: getProductsSearchQ
actions.description:
This resource returns same results as our web application. But you get it as JSON objects -
the result is an JSON array of product objects.

When there's no match for the query, the result array will be empty.

lang.description:
Filter results by programming languages;
                                  For filtering multiple languages submit a comma separated list of language strings.

g.description: Filter by GroupID. This is Java/Maven specific

actions.title: getProductsShaSha
actions.description: This Endpoint expects a SHA value and returns the corresponding product to it, if available.

actions.title: getProductsLangProdKey
actions.description:
Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

  * API returns 404, when the product with given product key doesnt exists.

  * Response 302 means that you didnt encode prod_key correctly.* (Replace all dots & slashes ) *

actions.title: deleteProductsLangProdKeyFollow
getProductsLangProdKeyFollow
actions.description:
Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

This resource will returns the status code 404 if there is no product
for the given prod_key.

actions.title: postProductsLangProdKeyFollow
actions.description:
Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

It will respond 404, when you are using wrong product key or encode it uncorrectly.

actions.title: getProductsLangProdKeyReferences
actions.description:
It returns the references of a package.

Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

This resource will return the status code 404 if there is no product for
the given prod_key or the product has 0 references.

actions.title: getProductsLangProdKeyVersions
actions.description:
Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

  * API returns 404, when the product with given product key doesnt exists.

  * Response 302 means that you didnt encode prod_key correctly.* (Replace all dots & slashes ) *

actions.title: postProductsLangProdKeyProdVersionLicense
actions.description: With this endpoint users can suggest a license for an artifact.

license_source.description: source of the license. Where did you find it?

comments.description: you wanna say anyting important to this license?

actions.title: postProductsLangProdKeyProdVersionScmChanges
actions.description:
This resource can parse a changelog.xml from the maven-changelog-plugin, assign
it to a specific artifact and display the changelog infos on the product page.

Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

It will respond 404, when you are using wrong product key or encode it uncorrectly.

actions.title: getProjects
actions.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

orga_name.description: The name of the organisation the project is assigned to.

team_name.description: The name of the team in the organisation this project is assigned to.

actions.title: postProjects
actions.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

visibility.description: By default 'public'. If 'public' everybody can see the project.

name.description: The name of the VersionEye project. By default it is the filename.

orga_name.description: The name of the organisation this project should be assigned to.

team_name.description: The name of the team in the organisation this project should be assigned to.

temp.description: If 'true' this project will not show up in the UI and gets removed later.

actions.title: getProjectsGroupIdArtifactIdMergeGaChildId
actions.description:
This endpoint merges a project (child_id) into another project (group_id/artifact_id).
This endpoint is specially for Maven based projects!
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

actions.title: getProjectsParentIdMergeChildId
actions.description:
This endpoint merges a project (child_id) into another project (parent_id).
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

actions.title: getProjectsParentIdUnmergeChildId
actions.description:
This endpoint unmerges a project (child_id) from another project (parent_id). It makes the
chilld again a separate project!
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

actions.title: deleteProjectsProjectKey
actions.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

project_key.description: Delete project with given project ID.

actions.title: getProjectsProjectKey
actions.description: It shows detailed info of your project.

actions.title: postProjectsProjectKey
actions.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

actions.title: getProjectsProjectKeyLicenses
actions.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

actions.title: getSecurity
actions.description: Security Vulnerabilities

actions.title: getServicesPing
actions.description: check is the service up and running

actions.title: deleteSessions
actions.description: Close current session. It's very handy method when you re-generated your current API-key.

actions.title: getSessions
actions.description:
If current user has active session, then this
method will return 200 with short user profile.
For othercase, it will return error message with status code 401.

actions.title: postSessions
actions.description: You need to append your api_key to request.

actions.title: postSessionsLogin
actions.description: You need to append your api_key to request.

actions.title: getUsersUsername
actions.description: shows profile of given user_id

actions.title: getUsersUsernameComments
actions.description: shows user's comments

actions.title: getUsersUsernameFavorites
actions.description: shows user's favorite packages
